current.translation[1].definitions[0].de: a continuous movement of water in a river, lake, or sea
current.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Strong currents can be very dangerous for swimmers.
current.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: Some birds use warm air currents to help them fly.
currents of warm air rising from the plain
current.translation[1].definitions[2].de: a flow of electricity through a wire
current.translation[1].definitions[3].de: an idea, feeling, or opinion that a particular group of people has
current.translation[1].definitions[3].ex: The committee reflects the different political currents within the organization.
There was an underlying current of discontent among teachers.
current.translation[1].note_box[0].secti: Ocean currents carry young fish out to sea.
Tidal currents make the seas around the islands very rough.
On surfing beaches, strong currents are common.
Fast-flowing currents made the rescue job even harder.
Beaches usually have signs that warn of dangerous currents.
Sea currents flow at up to 12 miles per hour around parts of the coast.
Their boat was moving fast, carried by the current.
The treacherous currents have swept away three swimmers in the past year.
current.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: the current world price for crude oil
the budget for the current year
